my hill.

my hill

**MY HILL**

You wake up and it is very dark, you try to look outside but all you see is rock.

Seems someone built a bigger hill over your hill while you were sleeping.

**MY BIGGER HILL.**

Every night as you are sleeping i dig a little bit off of your big hill (so that you won't notice it got smaller when ya wake up) and now it is just a tiny lump of dirt on the ground.

**MY HILL**

BUT, a tiny lump of dirt on the ground ISN'T a hill. According to wikipedia, "*A **hill** is a [landform](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landform "Landform") that extends above the surrounding terrain. It often has a distinct [summit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summit_%28topography%29 "Summit (topography)")**.*" And a tiny lump of dirt does not extend above the surrounding terrain (because someone dropped a brick next to it and the brick is much higher than the lump of dirt). So put some HUGE boosters onto Gilly, and push it back through the ksp to real life wormhole from previous posts (i repaired it) and it crashes into the exact spot which your lump of dirt is on earth. Because of the heat and energy released by the impact, you lump of dirt is vaporised. The smoking remains of Gilly that is sticking out is now my hill. **MY HILL**
Of course not, i meant the previous hill is still mine. I just destroyed ColdJ's hill so that it is not bigger than mine.

When Gilly impacted it caused a huge crater that pushed up the the land all around it. Then it derezed because it still can't be maintained in our reality.

I claim all the surrounding impact ridge. (Sorry Maria but the impact destroyed your hill too)

**MY MOUNTAINOUS RING RIDGE HILL WITH IT'S OWN LAKE.**

I take a few nukes and nuke down almost all of the ridge. Now the nukes have left only a hill left of the mountainous impact ridge. Ya said you own the ridge (that no longer exists), not a hill.

**MY HILL**

Seriously, with all the nukes and planet pushing boosters you'd think we should be fighting over a planet rather than just a hill.

All the radiation kills off everything. 500 years later I turn up and claim the hill.

**MY HALFLIFE CLEANSED HILL.**

still, you didn't notice me hiding somewhere in a radiation proof bunker playing ksp for the last 500 years playing ksp without timewarp.

i get out, place some nuclear salt water rocket engines and open cycle gas core nulcear thermal rocket engines (they all have radioactive exhaust) and fire them at the hill. the hill is vapourised instantly in a radioactive plume of smoke.

i build a new hill on top of it while wearing a radiation proof suit and built  planet moving boosters around it for no reason whataoever because i like overkill

MY HILL

You have been alive so long that you have gone seriously senile, so you were actually hallucinating the whole time and are still sitting in your bunker in front of your screen and drooling uncontrollably. (I was in a different universe where a minute equals 100 years here, the whole time) Since nothing really happened it is still.

**MY HILL.**

I take my reverse-timer and reverse the planet to what it was like at the 7th post of this page of the thread. And since that post was mine, the hill is...

**MY HILL**
